alert.note: Alert for City of Bristol; Russell; Scott; Washington (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 5:20PM EDT until July 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Bristol, Russell, Scott and Washington. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms during the past hour. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour across parts of the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next hour or two. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bristol Va, Nickelsville, Dungannon, Collingwood, Hiltons, Benhams and Fort Blackmore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive across flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Bristol; Russell; Scott; Washington
